title: Task-Based Instructional Design Strategies for Practice-Centered Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency and foundational job-related knowledge
context.additional_context: Project-based instruction for in-service professionals to strengthen practical application skills.

learning_goals: Learners can perform language tasks reflecting real job situations with 80% accuracy.
Learners can develop educational materials by applying the four stages of instructional design (activation-presentation-application-integration).
Learners can explain the impact of a task-centered approach on language proficiency improvement through case analysis.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
